chapter.title: Upgrades between Minor Releases
chapter.para: Upgrades of the oVirt Engine are released via Red Hat Network. Before installing an update from the Red Hat Network be sure to read the advisory text associated with it as well as the most recent version of the oVirt — Release Notes, and the oVirt — Technical Notes.
To complete an upgrade a number of actions must be performed including:

listitem.para: downloading and installing the updated packages,
backing up and updating the database,

chapter.para: A script is included to perform all of these actions for you in an automated fashion. Active virtualization hosts are not upgraded by this process and must be updated separately. As a result the virtual machines running upon them are not affected.

Upgrading the oVirt Engine requires network connectivity with either Red Hat Network or a Red Hat Network Satellite Server installation. You must be logged in as the root user to initiate the upgrade process.

Before you upgrade your oVirt Engine installation ensure you have the latest version of the installation utilities by running yum update ovirt-setup as the root user. Once this has been done to commence an upgrade of the oVirt Engine run the ovirt-upgrade command, again as the root user. No additional parameters are required. The command will produce output when it has completed each step of the upgrade process.

Be aware that the upgrade process may take some time. Allow time for the upgrade process to complete and do not stop it once initiated. Once the upgrade has been completed you will also be instructed to separately upgrade the data warehouse and reports functionality. These additional steps are only required if these optional packages are installed.

note.title: Note — Upgrading oVirt Nodes
note.para: oVirt Nodes can be updated directly or via the oVirt Engine. For information on upgrading the node see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux — Node Deployment Guide.
